RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the United States Court of Appeals for t: the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: Case in which Maria De Jesus Garcia launches a two-pronged attack against the modified Allen charge given to the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the modified Allen charge: Charge given to the jury, subject of Maria De Jesus Garcia's appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States District Court: Court that used the modified Allen charge in United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: Case in which the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit rejected a general attack on the Allen charge as being inherently coercive
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: Case that affirmed the decision in United States v. Pena-Cantu
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: Case that upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Court of Appeals for t: Court responsible for considering the appeal of Maria De Jesus Garcia and for prior decisions on the Allen charge
